summary: The Health Accelerating Consumer’s Care by Expediting Self-Scheduling Act (Health ACCESS Act) amends title XI of the Social Security Act to improve patient access to healthcare by addressing barriers. Specifically, it focuses on regulating the relationship between healthcare providers and information service providers (web platforms) that help consumers find providers. The bill outlines specific conditions for payment from providers to information services, including transparency, objective criteria, limitations on steering and marketing, and fair market value compensation. It defines 'consumer' and 'information service provider' within the context of the act.
